title: sometimes there is a reason for leaving a match
body:
look i have a pc that isnt as bright as most and the game tends to f**k up my pc and make my screen go black
after a few seconds the pc resets and also makeing me exit the match.
what im saying is that instead of makeing them type "i agree", give them a chance to explain why they left and after try to resolve their problem

hope this gets to the devs, and someone please help me if you can.
have a good day

replies.body:
As *Timethief49* and *OMGitsaLLAMACORN* mentioned, regardless of your intent, disconnecting from a match leaves your teammates behind. We understand that sometimes emergencies happen, but a trend of disconnections could land you under a *low-priority queue* by the [**Leaverbuster System**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ).

From your symptoms, it sounds like your computer may be having system driver or hardware issues, so I recommend working through our [**Bugsplat/Crash Guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes). Please let me know if those steps were unable to resolve your issue.

the system has a tollerence to some extend but you are supposed to fix problems. if you cant and keep playing its on your own risk. you can ruin many peoples games by leaving even if its unintentional

This is a huge concern too me personally too, but what you need to understand is people can make lies about why they left and just mess with people. That is a big problem as Riot tries to make **their** game better and more fair. But leaverbuster is not a problem to them right now because it doesn't matter if you get leaverbusted or not for a specific reason that wasn't your fault, it's still leaving your team behind.

Sincerely, this is Llama, saying,  I'll see you! On the Rift!
